meanings.sent1: The compass in the aclinic zone was confused.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the aclinic behavior of the magnet.
meanings.sent3: The aclinic compass decided to take a break and point in random directions.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were aclinic, pointing in all directions at once.
meanings.sent5: The aclinic magnet was like a lost child, unsure which way to go.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to a region where the magnetic needle points to the true north.
meanings.sent1: The aclinic area always guided the sailors accurately.
meanings.sent2: The map highlighted the aclinic regions for easy navigation.
meanings.sent3: The aclinic compass whispered secrets of the true north.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was aclinic, always pointing towards the truth.
meanings.sent5: The aclinic magnet was a reliable friend, always showing the right direction.
